meanings.definition: Relating to ancient Greek or Roman literature, art, or culture.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed many classicals artifacts from ancient Greece.
meanings.sent2: She admired the classicals columns of the old building.
meanings.sent3: The classicals pottery in the exhibit made her feel like a time traveler.
meanings.sent4: His love for classicals literature was as deep as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The classicals sculptures seemed to come alive in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Traditional or typical of a particular form or style.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant served classicals dishes that reminded him of home.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was elegant and classicals, perfect for the occasion.
meanings.sent3: The classicals dance moves at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His classicals manners were a breath of fresh air in today's world.
meanings.sent5: The classicals architecture of the building stood the test of time.

meanings.definition: A type of music that is considered to be part of a long, formal tradition.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed listening to classicals while studying for her exams.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played beautiful classicals pieces at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The classicals music filled the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent4: His passion for classicals was evident in the way he conducted the symphony.
meanings.sent5: The classicals melodies echoed through the halls, enchanting all who listened.
